person.persName: Benjamin F. Blankenship (Harlan County soldier and farmer)

body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Lived in Harlan County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Elizabeth Blankenship. Father of Emily Blankenship and Arthur Blankenship. Served as major of the Harlan County Battalion of Kentucky State Militia from October 1862 to January 1863. Served as a captain in the 47th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (Co. H) from October 1863 to December 1864. Served as postmaster of Poor Fork in Harlan County, Kentucky from June 1859 to July 1863, September 1865 to December 1868, and March 1869 to May 1870.
